comments:
Using the M8 workbench with a more-recent M9 Hyades (from April 3), I find that 
the Workbench drives the RAC properly to start the target Java program, but 
doesn't send appropriate commands over the RAC to the agent, including 
a "RESUME" command that would let the target program start running.

I have attached the servicelog.log file after changing the loggingDetail 
to "HIGH" and the loggingLevel to "DEBUG." 

Using other debugging means I have determined that the target java.exe is 
started with piAgent attached, the agent calls ra_startListener, and the 
listener thread receives one command of type 80. But after that, no other 
commands arrive through the RAC, and the java.exe process just hangs waiting 
for them.

The visible behavior on the Workbench is that "Launch" appears in the lower-
right corner with an animated progress indicator, but after 10-20 seconds it 
disappears. The Profiling Monitor view remains blank.

My co-worker is able to profile with no problems. I can't explain why her 
machine works while mine fails. I have a faster machine than hers, and mine has 
hyperthreading (so it looks like a multiprocessor machine), but otherwise our 
environments seem identical.

Created an attachment (id=9264)
An annotated copy of the log with full debug enabled

Note: the "one command of type 80" is RA_AGENT_CONTROLLER_AVAILABLE, as defined 
in RAComm.h.

Here are the actual steps I followed:

1. Download and unzip WSWB M8 from 3/31 without Hyades. 
2. Unzip the Hyades build from 3-April into the eclipse directory.
3. Start Eclipse, create a Java project, put a class in there with a main 
function. 
4. Running this simple program works fine.
5. In a shell window, unzip the Windows RAC zip file, run SetConfig.bat, accept 
the defaults, set RASERVER_HOME, and run RAServer.exe. My JVM is from a Sun 
1.3.1 JRE, but I've tried others with no change.
6. Open the Profiling and Logging perspective, use Profile... and configure a 
new Java Application. Memory/Leak Analysis is selected, with "instance-level 
information" and the default filter set.
7. Hit "Run."

I get the word "Launch" in the lower right corner of my Workbench window, and 
an animated icon with four blocks. This ticks away for ten seconds or so, then 
disappears. Nothing appears in the Profiling Monitor view. The Java process is 
running, still waiting for the RESUME command.

I tried all this in a Run-Time Workbench, and in that case a 
NullPointerException appeared in the Console (on stderr):

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.UIPlugin.getActiveWorkbenchShell
(UIPlugin.java:139)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.util.PDCoreUtil.launchTrace
(PDCoreUtil.java:812)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.ProfileLaunchDelegate.launch
(ProfileLaunchDelegate.java:69)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:569)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:150)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch
(DebugUIPlugin.java:774)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools.buildAndLaunch
(DebugUITools.java:629)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools$3.run(DebugUITools.java:585)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:62)

The code in getActiveWorkbenchShell is very simple: return 
getActiveWorkbenchWindow().getShell();
This means getActiveWorkbenchWindow() returned null.

More info: the NullPointerException given above is real, but it's something of 
a red herring, maybe a race condition while trying to report an error. That has 
now been filed as 57636 and it's being worked.

The error being reported is another NullPointerException with this traceback: 

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.UIPlugin.getActivePage(UIPlugin.java:96)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.trace.internal.ui.PDProjectExplorer.getFromActivePerspective
(PDProjectExplorer.java:326)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.UIPlugin.getViewer(UIPlugin.java:213)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.piclient.PIProcessListener.processLaunched
(PIProcessListener.java:443)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.local.control.ProcessImpl.launch
(ProcessImpl.java:161)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.util.PDCoreUtil.launchTrace
(PDCoreUtil.java:788)
	at 
org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.launcher.ProfileLaunchDelegate.launch
(ProfileLaunchDelegate.java:69)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:569)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:150)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch
(DebugUIPlugin.java:774)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools.buildAndLaunch
(DebugUITools.java:629)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools$3.run(DebugUITools.java:585)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:62)

Allan, please assign this bug to me. (curtispd@ca.ibm.com)
This is essentially the same problem as with #57636.
Assigned to Curtis at his request.

Fixed.

The NullPointerException should no longer occur. The error dialog was trying to 
display the following:

IWAT0114E Configuration error on IBM Agent Controller.
Error exists in IBM Agent Controller configuration file: serviceconfig.xml. 
Make sure the IBM Agent Controller installation is correctly configured.

Also, this is an older error msg which assumed the IBM agent controller. 
Removed the word "IBM".
